result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.  nk
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($275.00) LW
Cash bond forfeited per court order.

Defendant Brian Harold Hall not in court. Prosecuting attorney Greg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant failing to appear. Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  NK
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9.14.22
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Violation Report 9.14.22
Received and Filed: Attorney Matthew Lamke

Defendant Brian Harold Hall in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defendant plans to enter into an alcohol treatment center, would like a 60 day adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
No contact order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $275.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. 24 hour curfew with the exception of verified medical and legal appointments.  Court ordered SCRAM bracelet to monitor the Defendant maintains absolute sobriety.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with HMS, HES.

DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES THIS CASE WAS HEARD OFF THE RECORD:
Defendant Brian Harold Hall in court with attorney William Scott Nelson.  Defendant Brian Harold Hall in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brian Harold Hall appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
